name: Baccarat Chemin de Fer
description: A high-stakes baccarat card game featured in the Casino Royale casino.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Baccarat Chemin de Fer is a variation of the baccarat card game, played primarily by high rollers and gamblers. Its primary purpose is to serve as a gambling game involving betting on the outcome of cards, where players compete against the bank. In Casino Royale, it functions as the centerpiece game where significant narrative events unfold.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The Baccarat Chemin de Fer game is played on a distinctive green baize table that is oval-shaped, featuring spaces for players and a dealer. The table includes designated areas for betting on 'Player', 'Banker', or a tie. The cards are traditional playing cards, dealt by the croupier. The setting is luxurious, typically surrounded by opulent lighting and attentive casino staff, underscoring the exclusivity of the game.

content.title: Function
content.body: In the Chemin de Fer variant, players take turns acting as the banker, with the dealer facilitating the game. Players place bets on whether the player's hand or the banker's hand will win, or if the outcome will be a tie. Cards are dealt and comparatively scored: the hand closest to a total of nine wins. Players have the option to draw a third card based on specific rules and strategic choice relevant to each hand's score.

content.title: History
content.body: Baccarat Chemin de Fer is a traditional French variant of baccarat dating back to the 19th century. It was historically popular among the European aristocracy in exclusive gambling salons. Within the world of Casino Royale, it represents the classic high-stakes atmosphere of the Casino Royale casino where elite gamblers and secret agents converge.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Baccarat Chemin de Fer game is central to the 2006 Casino Royale film, as it is the venue for the pivotal high-stakes gambling match between James Bond and Le Chiffre, the antagonist banker to terrorists. This game serves as a major plot device, allowing Bond to expose Le Chiffre's vulnerabilities, win crucial information, and advance the mission. Key dramatic scenes take place at this table, including tension-filled moments of bluff, psychology, and risk, reflecting the stakes of espionage and survival.
